DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe whether or not a history of testicular cancer exists and the specific diagnosis related to that history.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Tumors or cancer of the TESTIS. Germ cell tumors (GERMINOMA) of the testis constitute 95% of all testicular neoplasms._an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced._Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tumors or cancer of the TESTIS. Germ cell tumors (GERMINOMA) of the testis constitute 95% of all testicular neoplasms.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the testis.  Representative examples include fibroma, thecoma, benign Sertoli cell tumor, seminoma, embryonal carcinoma, sarcoma, leukemia, and lymphoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 4/24/13

Germ cell tumors (GERMINOMA) of the testis constitute 95% of all testicular neoplasms.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
Occurring at the same time or rate.
On or relating to the opposite side of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, history of metachronous contralateral testicular cancer
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Yes History of Metachronous Contralateral Testicular Cancer

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes History of Metachronous Contralateral Testicular Cancer
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.: A malignant tumor that arises at a site separate from another, primary malignant tumor in the same anatomic system.  It is not clear if metachronous malignant neoplasms represent new primary tumors or metastatic disease.  Examples include metachronous osteosarcoma of the bones that develops in patients with known primary bone osteosarcoma, and metachronous Wilms' tumor that affects the opposite kidney in patients with a history of Wilms' tumor.: On or relating to the opposite side (of the body): Tumors or cancer of the TESTIS. Germ cell tumors (GERMINOMA) of the testis constitute 95% of all testicular neoplasms.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

A malignant tumor that arises at a site separate from another, primary malignant tumor in the same anatomic system.  It is not clear if metachronous malignant neoplasms represent new primary tumors or metastatic disease.  Examples include metachronous osteosarcoma of the bones that develops in patients with known primary bone osteosarcoma, and metachronous Wilms' tumor that affects the opposite kidney in patients with a history of Wilms' tumor.
On or relating to the opposite side of the body.
A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the testis.  Representative examples include fibroma, thecoma, benign Sertoli cell tumor, seminoma, embryonal carcinoma, sarcoma, leukemia, and lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the testis.  Representative examples include fibroma, thecoma, benign Sertoli cell tumor, seminoma, embryonal carcinoma, sarcoma, leukemia, and lymphoma.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
